title: Newton woman facing assault, kidnapping, other charges around alleged unlicensed cosmetic surgery in Allston
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dingrui Wang, 34, of Newton is charged with assault, kidnapping, and unauthorized practice of medicine in Allston.
Wang allegedly performed unlicensed cosmetic surgery causing permanent damage and restrained the victim to complete the procedure.
Wang falsely claimed medical credentials, obtaining $37,379 in loans under false pretenses, Suffolk County DA's office reports.

title: Car rammed by train in Abington after breaking down on tracks
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 2007 Honda broke down on train tracks in Abington and was struck by an MBTA train.
The incident occurred around 8 p.m. near Plymouth St.; the train collided with the unoccupied vehicle.
The 35-year-old driver exited the car before the collision, and there were no reported injuries.

title: Woman, 57, walking in road due to snow hit and killed by car on Route 28 in Wareham, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 57-year-old woman was killed on Route 28 in Wareham after being hit by a Volvo Sunday night.
The woman and a man were struck while walking in the road because snow blocked the sidewalk, the DA said.
The black truck initially hit the pedestrians, and the Volvo struck the woman, resulting in her death.

title: Former North Shore police officer gets prison time for child porn charge
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Gloucester police officer Alexander Aiello sentenced to 4 years in prison and 5 years of supervised release.
Aiello pleaded guilty to receiving child pornography after hundreds of illicit files were found on an encrypted thumb drive.
Police investigation revealed Aiello used a Tor Browser and visited a child pornography website multiple times between 2024 and 2025.

title: ‘The finest kind’: Gloucester mourns 7 lost in Lily Jean sinking as Coast Guard launches probe
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Seven people are presumed dead following the sinking of the Gloucester-based fishing boat, Lily Jean, off Cape Ann.
The U.S. Coast Guard and National Transportation Safety Board are investigating the incident; the search for survivors was suspended Saturday.
Gloucester mourns the crew, labeled 'the finest kind,' as locals reflect on their dedication to fishing and community legacy.

title: Why readers think Bill Belichick belonged in the Hall of Fame this year
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Boston.com readers largely viewed Bill Belichick's Hall of Fame snub as undeserved, citing his coaching achievements.
Belichick's NFL record includes eight Super Bowl titles, but he fell short of the 40-out-of-50 votes needed for induction.
Critics argued Belichick's success was tied to Tom Brady and cited team scandals as reasons against his first-ballot induction.

title: Which Patriots Super Bowl will you never forget?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston.com invites fans to share their most unforgettable New England Patriots Super Bowl memories, both on and off the field.
Iconic Patriots moments include Adam Vinatieri's 48-yard field goal in 2002 and Malcolm Butler's game-saving interception against the Seahawks.
Fans can submit their stories via email for potential inclusion in a future Boston.com article about memorable Patriots Super Bowl experiences.

title: This runner is raising awareness about stroke and heart disease
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Liz Lang, 48, from Jackson, NJ, runs the 2026 Boston Marathon to raise awareness on stroke and heart disease.
Diagnosed with antiphospholipid syndrome, Lang highlights the importance of perseverance and self-advocacy in health management.
Lang fundraises for Tedy’s Team, supporting research and outreach efforts for heart disease and stroke warning signs.

title: Once a patient, now a runner: She’s running for Boston Children’s Hospital
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Molly Kokoski, 26, is running the Boston Marathon to raise funds for Boston Children's Hospital.
Diagnosed with ulcerative colitis, Kokoski uses an ostomy bag and attributes her health to Boston Children's Hospital.
A Massachusetts native, Kokoski aims to show others that an ostomy doesn't have to limit one's life.

title: Saks OFF 5th to close Massachusetts stores
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Saks OFF 5th locations in Somerville and Wrentham, MA, will close as part of Saks Global's bankruptcy restructuring.
Saks Global, owner of several luxury brands, will focus on high-end retail, closing most discount stores.
The bankruptcy stems from competition and debt from purchasing Neiman Marcus over a year ago.
